plant_translocations.content: Xylem translocation and root uptake of weak electrolytes were investigated using the pressure chamber technique (PCT) with de-topped soybean plants. The study focused on two organic bases (fenpropimorph and imazalil) and four organic acids (bentazone, primisulfuron-methyl, rimsulfuron, and triasulfuron), covering a wide range of log Kow and pKa values. Measurements were taken at different pH levels in the external solution. Results showed that translocation of weak bases was higher at low pH, with transpiration stream concentration factors (TSCF) ranging from 0.31 to 0.95. For weak acids, TSCF values varied from 0.55 to 1.50 for primisulfuron-methyl, 0.64 to 1.35 for rimsulfuron, 0.81 to 0.93 for triasulfuron, and 0.69 to 0.92 for bentazone. The study suggested that de-topped soybean plants in the pressure chamber were unable to regulate their xylem sap pH, leading to smaller variations in TSCF compared to intact plants. This lack of pH regulation affected the ion-trap process responsible for the accumulation or exclusion of weak electrolytes in the xylem of living plants.
plant_translocations.reference: Ciucani, G., Trevisan, M., Sacchi, G. A., & Trapp, S. A. J. (2002). Measurement of xylem translocation of weak electrolytes with the pressure chamber technique. Pest management science, 58(5), 467-473.

method.Plant Growth Condition: Seeds germinated for 5 days, then grown hydroponically in Hoagland's solution in 10L containers in glasshouse (26°C day/18°C night). Plants used at R1-R2 early flowering stage, 20-27 days old.
method.Chemical Preparation: Seven compounds from different chemical families investigated - bentazone, fenpropimorph, imazalil, primisulfuron-methyl, rimsulfuron, and triasulfuron. Purity ranged from 95-99.6%. Compounds dissolved in hydroponic solution at 0.5 mg/L concentration, buffered at pH 4.5, 6.5, 8.5 with 50 mM MMES-TRIS buffer.
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: Excised plants with roots bathed in pesticide solution under 0.3-0.4 MPa hydrostatic pressure generated by compressed air with 7% oxygen.
method.Other Information: Experiments run for 6h with at least 4 replicates per compound, one 15h experiment. Xylem sap collected at 0.1 mL/min flow rate. Pesticide concentrations measured by HPLC. Transpiration stream concentration factor (TSCF) and root concentration factor (RCF) calculated.

plant_translocations.result: [{"PH": 4.5, "Root concentration factors (RCF)": 107, "Transpiration stream concentration factors": "0.51"}, {"PH": 6.5, "Root concentration factors (RCF)": 136, "Transpiration stream concentration factors": "0.3"}, {"PH": 8.5, "Root concentration factors (RCF)": 445, "Transpiration stream concentration factors": "-"}]
